head.title: POSTINGS: A Guidebook of Lower Manhattan; Walking Tours Of Downtown

hedline.hl1: POSTINGS: A Guidebook of Lower Manhattan; Walking Tours Of Downtown

abstract.p: Guidebook for walking tours of lower Manhattan to be published by New York Landmarks Conservancy (S)

block.p: A 163-page guidebook for walking tours of lower Manhattan is to be published early next month by the New York Landmarks Conservancy. The paperback volume contains descriptions of the physical development and business history of the area and has three walking tours with more than 90 stops.
The stops are laid out on detailed maps and illustrated by period photographs and drawings.

A 163-page guidebook for walking tours of lower Manhattan is to be published early next month by the New York Landmarks Conservancy. The paperback volume contains descriptions of the physical development and business history of the area and has three walking tours with more than 90 stops.
The stops are laid out on detailed maps and illustrated by period photographs and drawings.

''Touring Lower Manhattan: Three Walks in New York's Historic Downtown'' was written by Andrew S. Dolkart and Steven Wheeler. Mr. Dolkart, who teaches at the Columbia University School of Architecture, Planning and Historic Preservation, has written books on city landmarks and on the architecture and development of Morningside Heights. Mr. Wheeler is the archivist for the New York Stock Exchange and co-author of an illustrated history, ''The New York Stock Exchange: The First 200 Years.''

The new guide is the fourth in a series. Earlier titles are ''Touring the Upper East Side,'' ''Touring Historic Harlem'' and ''Touring the Flatiron.'' The newest volume can be bought for $12 at bookstores or at the conservancy, at 141 Fifth Avenue, at 21st Street. Credit card purchases may be made by telephone at (212) 995-5260 or through the organization's Web site: www.nylandmarks.org.
